description: This course is about the impact of regulation on the private law of banking and financial services. This would typically include how regulatory rules create private law duties in contract or tort. It will be of interest to those interested in financial contracts, financial institutions and the regulation and supervision of financial markets and institutions including banks. Financial services constitute an important sector of the economy. Financial markets and institutions including banks are subject to a rapidly expanding field of public regulation. Its implementation and enforcement raise many underexplored challenges.
preclusion: LL4376 / LL5376 / LL6376 Regulation & Private Law in Banking & Financial Service
title: Regulation & Private Law in Banking & Financial Service
